description: Many furnishings will be 20 percent off at the Conran Shop, April 7 to 9 (the Eileen desk, regularly $1,750, will be $1,400); 888 Broadway (19th Street), (212) 755-9079, conranusa.com.

title: Cool Food With Less Waiting
description: Some problems are so obvious that you wonder why technology hasnt already addressed them. Take slow-cooling refrigerators. We sent a man to the moon in 1969, yet it still takes upwards of an hour to cool down a warm can of Mountain Dew?

title: A Faceted Light With a Surprise
description: Maxhedron, the latest light fixture by Bec Brittain, a Brooklyn designer, appears to change states when you flip the switch. I became interested in the idea of a one-way mirror, and the light grew out of that, Ms. Brittain said. Its not a high-tech material, and were all familiar with the idea of it, but its really magical the way light can transform it.

title: The Brooklyn Museum Shop Expands
description: As part of the transformation of its first floor, the Brooklyn Museum has opened an expanded 4,150-square-foot shop with plenty of display space and a special focus on items designed and made in the borough.

title: An Emotional Gretzky Talks About His Fathers Illness
description: The hockey star Wayne Gretzky paced the stage in the vast Vancouver Convention Centre as the featured speaker of the Association of Fundraising Professionals 49th annual convention Tuesday.

title: Valentine Maintains a New York Presence
description: Bobby Valentine will not leave New York behind, nearly 10 years after the Mets fired him as their manager. Although he is now the Boston Red Sox manager, he will appear weekly in New York on ESPN Radio, giving him a platform to tease the Yankees or, perhaps, his former team.

title: Officials Are Set to Seize Antiquity
description: Federal agents in New York on Wednesday moved to seize a thousand-year-old Cambodian statue from Sothebys, alleging in a civil complaint that Sothebys had put the 10th-century figure of a mythological warrior up for auction despite knowing that it had been stolen from a temple.

title: Lundqvists Status Uncertain; Rangers Reflect on Clinching Victory
description: The Rangers did not practice Wednesday, so no word on the condition of Henrik Lundqvist, whose right forearm was stung by a shot in the last few seconds of the second period in Tuesdays conference-title-clinching victory in Philadelphia.

title: Should Patients Be Told the Hard Truth?
description: To the Editor:

title: Working Conditions at Apples Overseas Factories
description: To the Editor:

title: Use of Strip Searches
description: To the Editor:

title: Santorum and Catholics
description: To the Editor:

title: Gardening by the App
description: MANY gardeners may prefer digging in the dirt to fiddling with a mobile device. But an increasing number of gardening apps now available might change that attitude, by helping with tasks like designing plots and choosing crops, and perhaps improving yields. The apps range in price from free to about $10  although a higher price doesnt guarantee a better or more sophisticated program. Here are 10 of the freshest picks for iOS and Android devices.

title: Big Brother Is Watching, and Hes a Bug
description: Since the fate of humanity is often hanging in the balance, science fiction rarely has a problem with dramatic stakes. Thats part of its appeal, and why the genre lends itself to urgent  if sometimes woolly  philosophical reflection.

title: What Should the Tappan Zees Future Look Like?
description: Built from a scaled-down design and described by one of its consulting engineers as one of the ugliest bridges in the East, the Tappan Zee Bridge has never been hailed as an aesthetic or engineering marvel.

title: Homes for $600,000
description: Properties in Denver, Philadelphia and Georgia.

title: What You Get for ... $600,000
description: ENGLEWOOD, COLO.

title: Pedro E. Guerrero on Being Inspired by the Masters
description: The architectural photographer Pedro E. Guerrero was a contemporary of the more famous Julius Shulman and trained at what is now the Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, Calif. After World War II, he lived in New Canaan, Conn., where he photographed the work of modern architects like Marcel Breuer, Eero Saarinen and Philip Johnson for House & Garden, Vogue and other magazines. And later in his career, he documented the work of the sculptors Louise Nevelson and Alexander Calder.

title: Voter Suppression, Again, in Minnesota This Time
description: I never cease to be amazedin a really bad wayat the lengths to which Republican lawmakers will go to cut down the number of people who get to vote (preferably, of course, people who might vote Democratic).

title: Eluding a Barrage of Spam Text Messages
description: Do you need up to $1,300 today? I was recently asked. Except for perhaps Mark Zuckerberg, who doesnt?

title: For Home Buyers, an App to Assess a Houses Attributes
description: Can a smartphone give you an edge in the competition for that great new house on the market?

title: A Communitys Hopes for Self-Sufficiency
description: Aliette Frank, a postdoctoral scholar at Royal Roads University, explores sustainable community development on the coast of British Columbia.

title: Escaping to the Citys Bustle
description: NEW JERSEY isnt far from Manhattan, but in lifestyle, it can feel a world apart. Thats why Barbara Littman, an interior designer who lives in Highland Park, N.J., insists on having an urban pied--terre.

title: In Manhattan, Bright and Modern
description: Barbara Littmans Chelsea penthouse is a modern Manhattan escape from her home in New Jersey.

title: Brainstorming Ways to Turn Tappan Zee Into Park
description: One drawing envisions a sprawling Seurat-like park scene with the towers of Manhattan beckoning in the distance. Others call for two ghost piers beginning at opposite sides over the river but not meeting, elegantly terraced gardens and plantings, a simple walkway surrounded by wind generators, photovoltaic cells and other examples of green energy.

title: Inhabiting the Pink Palace
description: An Austin, Tex., co-op, home to a revolving cast of roommates, is locally renowned for its over-the-top theme parties.

title: Whats Pink and Wild and Known All Over?
description: AUSTIN, Tex.

title: StudentsFirstNY Announces Itself
Ferris State Hopes to Keep Making History on Ice
description: TAMPA, Fla.  It seems only fitting that a team from Big Rapids, Mich., would dream big. Never mind that Ferris States mens hockey team had qualified for the N.C.A.A. postseason only once before, in 2003, and bowed out quickly. Or that the Bulldogs were picked to finish ninth in their league last September. This seasons club believed it could make history.

title: South Sudan Says It Shot Down Sudan Jet Amid Clashes
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  South Sudan said that it shot down a north Sudanese fighter jet in its territory on Wednesday, as the two national armies continue to clash in a dispute that international observers worry may be inching closer to war.

title: Reinventing the Tappan Zee Bridge
description: Students envision new pedestrian uses for the aging span, after it is replaced by a new bridge.

title: An Arab War-Crimes Court for Syria
description: THE United States and other governments dont want to intervene militarily in Syria. Thats understandable; hardly anyone wants another Middle East war.

title: Natural Dyes
description: Marigolds, rose hips, cabbage: if youre looking at a plant, youre looking at a potential dye.

title: Colors of the Caldron
description: WHEN you are a practicing alchemist, as Sasha Duerr is, strangers will often ask you to demonstrate your powers by heating up a caldron in the yard. Its a living, and Ms. Duerr is usually happy to give it a try. On a recent Monday afternoon, she had arranged to spark up three propane camp stoves and scavenge a few things to boil.

title: Acquainting Parents With New Special Ed Plans
Untangling a Border Could Leave a Mess for Some
description: CLOVER, S.C.  Errors can compound over time.

title: Refinery Gets a Look From Delta, Perplexing Analysts
description: Running an airline is a tough business. But running an oil refinery can be even more punishing.

title: How to Make Dye With Kitchen Staples
description: IF youre going to take up the art of natural dyeing, youll eventually want to stock an indoor-outdoor lab with a cooking thermometer, a food scale, tongs, strainers, measuring spoons, glass jars, plastic buckets, heatproof gloves and a splash-proof smock. But the list of absolute necessities is a little shorter: a pot.

title: Tennessee: 44 Years After Assassination, Memphis Names a Street for King
description: Memphis renamed a street in honor of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. on Wednesday, 44 years after he was assassinated there. More than 900 streets around the country are named for Dr. King, but Memphis is one of a few large cities in the South without one. The significance is that this was the last street that Dr. King ever marched on, said Edmund Ford Jr., a City Council member, referring to the stretch of Linden Avenue that was renamed Dr. M.L. King Avenue. Memphis has taken other steps to honor the civil rights leader. The National Civil Rights Museum opened in 1991 on the site of the motel where Dr. King was shot.

title: News Roundup: Deal on Night Raids, Marines in Australia, Irans Influence on Afghanistan
description: From Afghanistan to Australia, we are tracking a lot of war-related news today. First, two stories from Afghanistan. In the first, Matthew Rosenberg reports on negotiations between the Afghan government and the United States military on the use of night raids. The covert nighttime raids on Afghan homes have been used for years, and have been deeply unpopular with both President Hamid Karzai and the Afghan public for just as long.

title: Rhode Island: Federal Prosecutors Fight Governor Over Murder Suspect
description: A federal appeals panel heard arguments on Wednesday over Gov. Lincoln Chafees refusal to surrender a murder suspect to federal prosecutors. The suspect, Jason W. Pleau, 34, is accused of shooting a gas station employee in front of a federally insured bank in 2010. He has agreed to plead guilty and serve a life sentence without parole in Rhode Island, which does not have the death penalty. The governor is concerned that Mr. Pleau will face the death penalty if he is tried in federal court. Mr. Chafee is believed to be the first governor to refuse to surrender a suspect to the federal authorities.

title: Pinning Scottish Independence on a Fervor for 1314
description: STIRLING, Scotland  On a fine day, the granite memorial atop a grassy rise outside this ancient Scottish city offers a grand panorama  west to the craggy fastness of Stirling Castle, north to the hills that stand gateway to the highlands, east toward Scotlands capital, Edinburgh, and south across rolling lowlands that stretch onward to England.

title: California: City of Pasadena Is Sued in Killing of Unarmed Black Man
description: The parents of Kendrec McDade, an unarmed black man shot and killed by Pasadena police officers last month, have filed a lawsuit in federal court against the City of Pasadena, the police chief and the officers involved, claiming wrongful death and violation of civil rights. The lawsuit says that a pattern of abuse by the Police Department led in part to the death of Mr. McDade, 19, and it lists other episodes in recent years in which black men were injured or killed during encounters with the police. The police were pursuing Mr. McDade after a 911 caller reported he had been robbed at gunpoint by two young black men. The police said Mr. McDade was shot after reaching for his waistband, causing officers to believe he was armed.

title: Sept. 11 Suspects to Be Tried by Military
description: The Defense Department has referred charges including terrorism, hijacking, murder and war crimes against Khalid Sheikh Mohammed and four others accused of planning the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks to a commission for trial by a military judge at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, the Pentagon said on Wednesday. The five, who will be arraigned within 30 days, could be sentenced to death if convicted. Earlier proceedings against the men were suspended when the Obama administration proposed a civilian trial in New York. Congressional and local opposition stymied the move.

title: In New York, Hyundai Doubles Down on the Santa Fe
description: Introduced on Wednesday, April 4: 2013 Santa Fe and Santa Fe Sport.

title: Down the Insurance Rabbit Hole
description: Cambridge, Mass.

title: A Presidential Race Leaves French Muslims Feeling Like Outsiders
description: MARSEILLE, France  Nassurdine Haidari knows that people like himself  black and Muslim and a former imam  are not a target audience for Frances presidential candidates. But he is outraged nonetheless that voters in the banlieues, the poor, heavily immigrant suburbs of French cities, are not only taken for granted but are also used as symbols to promote racial and religious anxiety.

title: New Balance Celebrates Its Homemade Footprint
description: NEW BALANCE is introducing a 30th anniversary model of its 990 running shoe with an advertising campaign that emphasizes its production in the United States.

title: Libya: Court Demands Handover of Qaddafi Son for Trial at Hague
description: Judges at the International Criminal Court on Wednesday ordered Libyan authorities to surrender Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi, a son of Libyas former leader Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi,and send him to the court in The Hague without further ado. It was the second but most strongly worded order from the court, which wants to try the sonon charges of crimes against humanity for his role in the violent suppression of the uprising the led to his fathers overthrow. Mr. Qaddafi was captured in November and has been held by a local militia in the town of Zintan. Libya has refused to turn him over to the court, insisting that he will be tried there. A report by the courts public defense office said that Libyan prosecutorshad preparedonly vague andminor charges against Mr. Qaddafi, and refusedhis requests to see a lawyer or membersof his family. The report also said that Libyasprosecutors had no timetable to move him to Tripoli for trial.

title: Census Data Offers Look at Effects of Recession
description: The Census Bureau offered the first detailed picture of population shift in the United States since the end of the recession, releasing data that showed that population growth in outer suburbs  the fastest growing areas in the last decade  all but ground to a halt in 2010 and 2011, as the painful effects of the housing crisis lingered.

title: Embarrass the Future?
description: Nothing in the Supreme Court arguments in the health care case last week, or in the subsequent commentary, has changed my opinion that this is an easy case. Its the court that made it look hard.

title: Honda Crosstour: Conceptual in Name Only
description: Introduced on Wednesday, April 4: 2013 Honda Crosstour Concept.

title: Touchy Day at Augusta National Mens Club
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.

title: Huffington Gains More Control in AOL Revamping
description: One year after its acquisition by AOL, The Huffington Post has become a source of growth for the beleaguered company, which is still trying to shed its dial-up Internet image. Now, in what Arianna Huffington characterizes as a move to keep the Web sites growth accelerating, she has taken several of its business functions out of AOL and under her control.

title: Wall Street Examines Fine Print in a Bill for Start-Ups
description: Wall Street is examining whether it will benefit from a little-known section of a broad new law that President Obama is expected to sign on Thursday.

title: Santorum Sees Long Campaign Road Ahead, but Many See Dead End
description: In public, Rick Santorum brushes off the messages from party leaders and rising numbers of conservative voters that the Republican race is all but over, that his campaign has entered its end game.

title: For Bettors, Masters Is a Major Event, Too
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Golf and gambling have been linked forever. Countless weekend foursomes begin their rounds with the familiar first-tee question: So, what are we playing for today? Lee Trevino even said that real pressure is playing for $10 a hole when you dont have a dime in your pocket.

title: Christie Leaning on Tax Subsidies in Hunt for Jobs
description: Panasonic received $102.4 million in tax credits to move its headquarters nine miles within New Jersey. Goya Foods picked up $81.9 million in credits to build offices and a warehouse in Jersey City, two miles from its current complex. Prudential Insurance obtained $250.8 million to move a few blocks to a new tower in Newark.

title: A Chest of Drawers
description: THE antiques restorer Christophe Pourny has had plenty of time to perfect his French polish. Mr. Pourny, 49, grew up as the son of antiques dealers in the South of France, where there was a never-ending inventory of pieces that needed touching up or refinishing.

title: Woodson Wants Smith to Keep His Composure
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  As the Knicks dribbled through the final minutes of practice Wednesday, two figures moved to the periphery, to a set of metal bleachers on the far side of the gymnasium.

title: Antonio Tabucchi, Elegiac Italian Writer, Dies at 68
description: Antonio Tabucchi, a distinguished Italian novelist whose work, with its almost palpable sympathy for the oppressed, became a standard held aloft by opponents of the right-wing government of former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi, died on March 25 in Lisbon. He was 68.

title: Santorum Links Obama and Romney on Gun Policies
description: HOLLIDAYSBURG, Pa.  Rick Santorum has become adept during the campaign at linking Mitt Romney, who leads the Republican presidential nominating contest, and President Obama on numerous issues, including health care and energy policy. On Wednesday, during his first day of campaigning in Pennsylvania, Mr. Santorum linked them on their views toward guns.

title: Arsenic in Our Chicken?
description: Lets hope youre not reading this column while munching on a chicken sandwich.

title: Engineers Convene to Seek Ways to Strengthen New York States Power Grid
description: It was described by one participant as a party for engineers: a conference of more than 500 specialists brainstorming about a grid so powerful that New York State could embrace wind power, cut electricity rates and close the Indian Point nuclear plant.

title: Robert R. Beezer, Conservative Voice on Liberal Court, Dies at 83
description: Judge Robert R. Beezer, who brought a conservative voice to one of the more liberal federal appeals courts in the United States, the Ninth Circuit, and who wrote influential opinions on capital punishment, copyright law on the Internet and Anna Nicole Smiths claim to a huge inheritance, died on Friday in Seattle. He was 83.

title: Ready or Not, Here Comes Duda
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  With the expectations and uncertainties that enwrap him, Lucas Duda has in many ways become a perfect emblem for the Mets state of affairs at the start of the 2012 season.

title: Maids Cries Cast Light on Child Labor in India
description: NEW DELHI  The girls screams were brittle and desperate. Neighbors in the suburban housing complex looked up and saw a child crying for help from an upstairs balcony. She was 13 and worked as a maid for a couple who had gone on vacation to Thailand. They had left her locked inside their apartment.

title: A Fallen Worker Had Proudly Joined the Family Trade
description: He came from a long line of construction workers, so it was no surprise that Michael J. Simermeyer was drawn into the family trade.

title: Work Is Halted at Subway Site After Fatal Crane Collapse
description: A day after a fatal crane collapse, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority shut down all work at the construction site for the No. 7 subway extension to Manhattans Far West Side, leaving a 60-foot-deep pit that looked like an underground ghost city for various investigators to mine for evidence of the accidents cause.

title: Santa Monica College Defends Use of Pepper Spray as Students Resume Protest
description: The president of Santa Monica College issued a statement on Wednesday defending campus police for using pepper spray on students protesting a two-tiered tuition pricing policy at a Board of Trustees meeting.

title: Send in the Clowns, and Cheese
description: Our question for today is: What lessons can be learned from the current scandal involving the 2010 Western Regions Conference of the General Services Administrations Public Buildings Service?

title: Budget Author, a Romney Ally, Turns Into a Campaign Focus
description: WASHINGTON  With Mitt Romney on a steady march to the Republican presidential nomination after a sweep of three primaries, both he and President Obama are seizing on the Republican House budget, and its ambitious young architect, Representative Paul D. Ryan, as a defining issue of the unfolding campaign.

title: Yankees Unexpectedly Trade for a Catcher and Send Cervelli to the Minors
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Less than an hour after hitting his first home run this spring in the Yankees Grapefruit League finale, Francisco Cervelli was summoned to a meeting Wednesday with Manager Joe Girardi that he never saw coming. He had anticipated being the backup catcher, but an injury and an unexpected trade had devastating consequences.

title: Its Mitt! Oh No.
description: The dream is dying. There will be no dynamic, charismatic, Reaganesque Republican presidential nominee this cycle. There wont even be a consistent conservative. There will only be Mitt Romney.

title: Things I Saw  No. 3
description: Suggestions for what youd like Jason to see and draw may be sent to thingsisaw@nytimes.com.

title: Haunted by the Primaries
description: Mitt Romneys three primary victories on Tuesday probably shut off what little oxygen remained for the campaigns of his rivals for the Republican nomination.

title: Players Sidestep Question of Augusta Membership Practices
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  There are many tight spots a Masters contestant can find himself in at Augusta National, not the least of which is having great affection for a tournament run by a club that would not allow ones wife, mother or daughter to become a member.

title: Faculty Gives Yale a Dose of Dissent Over Singapore
description: NEW HAVEN  Yale announced a year ago that it was creating the first new college to bear the Yale name in 300 years at the National University of Singapore, and last week, after reviewing 2,500 applications, it sent out the first handful of faculty job offers for Yale-N.U.S. College.

title: Costs, Benefits and Your Drug Plan
description: It seems counterintuitive, but the Federal Trade Commission has just decided that a $29 billion merger of two of the three largest companies that manage pharmaceutical benefits for employers and health plans  Express Scripts and Medco Health Solutions  would not substantially lessen competition. That judgment deserves credence because of the thoroughness of the F.T.C.s eight-month inquiry and the willingness of the agency to oppose other mergers when the evidence warrants.

title: Cleaner Fuels, Cleaner Cars
description: In late December, the Environmental Protection Agency drafted a set of rules that would force petroleum refiners to reduce the amount of sulfur in gasoline by two-thirds. That change would enhance the effectiveness of catalytic converters in both old and new cars, resulting in substantial cuts in soot and smog-forming pollutants from automobile tailpipes.

title: Anti-American Egyptian Candidate May Be Tripped Up by Mothers U.S. Ties
description: CAIRO  An ultraconservative Islamist whose denunciations of American power have helped propel him to the front of Egypts presidential race appears to have been tripped up by his own American connections.

title: Two Sides of Big-Time Basketball
description: Kentucky and Baylor both won national championships this week, but Brittney Griner and her team did it the way it should be done in college basketball, says William C. Rhoden.

title: Courts Potential to Goad Voters Swings to Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  For decades, Republicans have railed every four years against the Supreme Court and its perceived liberal activism to spur conservatives to elect presidents who will appoint like-minded justices. Now strategists in both parties are suggesting this could be the Democrats year to make the court a foil to mobilize voters.

title: City Hospitals Reach $11 Million Scholarship Deal With Medical School in Grenada
description: Over the last few years, St. Georges University Medical School on the Caribbean island of Grenada has come under fire from New York City medical schools for paying to have its students trained in the citys public hospitals, turning what local schools say should be an academic relationship into a fiscal one.

title: One and Done for Alma Mater
description: A disquieting postscript to March Madness is the expectation that the starting five of the University of Kentuckys national champion team  a mix of sophomores and freshmen  will soon jump into the professional basketball drafts potential riches years shy of a diploma. Fans are right to ask whatever happened to verities like amateurism, education and team loyalty in college sports.

title: Caught in the Middle With You
description: Administrivial New Puzzle Contest Alert! Constructor Pete Muller is launching a brand new, Monthly Music Meta (say that three times fast!) puzzle contest on his website, pmxwords.com. Sign up is free and you can win semi-valuable prizes, the grandest of which MIGHT be free registration at the next American Crossword Puzzle Tournament. Give it a try!

title: Video: Two Sides of Big-Time Basketball
description: Kentucky and Baylor both won national championships this week, but Brittney Griner and her team did it the way it should be done in college basketball, says William C. Rhoden.

title: Electronic Dance Concerts Turn Up Volume, Tempting Investors
description: One Friday afternoon last month, 60,000 tickets at $100 and up went on sale for a major music festival at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, N.J., before the headliners had even been announced.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: April 4, 2012

title: Appeals Court Hears Arguments on Gay Marriage Law
description: BOSTON  A federal appeals court panel heard arguments Wednesday on whether to uphold a lower courts finding that a section of the 1996 law banning federal recognition of same-sex marriage is unconstitutional.

title: Staten Island Fights Reeds That Feed Its Brush Fires
description: Of all the natural calamities New Yorkers might face, brush fires are probably low on the list  unless one lives on Staten Island. There have been several thousand of them since the mid-1990s, fed by large stands of reeds known as phragmites that wave in the spring breeze like so much tinder.

title: Bringing Dollars and Cents Into This Century
A Rose-Colored View May Come Standard
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Google on Wednesday offered a look at a previously secret project to develop Internet-connected glasses, staking out a lead position in a futuristic and fast-growing area known as wearable computing.

title: Accuser Describes Attack by Priest in Pennsylvania
description: PHILADELPHIA  A 30-year-old man said Wednesday that a priests actions took the man down a path that included more than a decade of drug and alcohol abuse, multiple criminal convictions and three suicide attempts.

title: On Opening Day, Marlins Stadium Overshadows Their Play
description: MIAMI  After years of planning, political wrangling and begrudging compromise, a new era in baseball began Wednesday night in Miami.

title: Learning to Be a Pilot, With Fuel Running Out
description: Nightmares are made of such moments.

title: Soft Greens at Augusta
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  The mysteries that make Augusta National hard for the uninitiated golfer to solve are less puzzling when the greens are spongy from rain, as they were in this weeks practice rounds.

title: Special Parking Rules in New York City
description: Because of Holy Thursday, Good Friday and Passover, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City through Sunday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: Council Reluctantly Agrees to States Oversight of Detroits Fiscal Decisions
description: DETROIT  Hours before Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan was to start the process of assigning an emergency manager to take control of financially ailing Detroit, a divided City Council agreed on Wednesday night to a deal that gives an advisory board, partly appointed by the state, oversight of its financial decisions, budgets and union contracts.

title: DirecTV and Tribune Agree to Deal
description: Tribune Broadcasting and DirecTV announced an agreement Wednesday night to end a dispute over retransmission fees, returning programming to subscribers after a blackout that began early Sunday.

title: Plan to Let Poultry Plants Inspect Birds Is Criticized
description: WASHINGTON  Federal food safety inspectors said a proposal by the Agriculture Department to expand a pilot program that allows private companies to take over the inspections at poultry plants could pose a health risk by allowing contaminated meat to reach customers.

title: A Piece of the Masters, Its Oldest Chronicler, Is Missing
description: As the sun set on the 75th Masters a year ago Sunday, the fertile brain inside Furman Bishers head, partly hidden under a signature bucket hat, sent these words through his fingers to the keyboard:

title: Obama vs. Romney on Fiscal Issues
description: Obama vs. Romney on Fiscal Issues

title: Turkey: Aging Generals Face Trial for Violent 1980 Military Coup
description: Two former generals stood trial in Ankara on Wednesday for their roles in Turkeys violent 1980 military coup. Kenan Evren, 94, the former head of the army, and Tahsin Sahinkaya, 86, the former air force commander, who were absent because of poor health, face charges of staging a coup to overthrow the civilian government, punishable by life imprisonment. The coup was the most violent of the three military interventions in modern Turkey: 50 people were executed, 300 were killed in prisons and more than half a million were arrested, according to human rights groups. The generals are unlikely to be jailed because of their age and health.

title: Laich Guarantees a Berth for Capitals
description: So maybe it wasnt Mark Messier, guaranteeing victory for the Rangers over the Devils in 1994. But Brooks Laich, a respected veteran grinder for the Washington Capitals, became surprisingly brash about his teams hopes of clinching a playoff berth with two games left in the regular season.

title: Corrections: April 5
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Investigation Under Way at Howard
description: Howard University announced that it had temporarily suspended some of its athletes from competition while the university investigates possible N.C.A.A. rules violations. Kerry-Ann Hamilton, a spokeswoman for Howard, a historically black university in Washington, said she could not divulge the names of the athletes or their sports. She said, however, that most of the universitys teams would continue competing as usual. Howard has 7 mens sports and 10 for women.

title: Population Growth in New York City Is Outpacing 2010 Census, 2011 Estimates Show
description: New York City gained nearly 70,000 residents in the 15 months ended July 1, 2011, almost matching the growth of the 1990s, when an influx of foreigners set annual records, according to census estimates released on Wednesday.

title: Think Like a Doctor: A Crooked Walk
description: The Challenge: Can you solve the case of a young woman with an odd gait and slowly progressive weakness in her hips and legs?

title: Word of the Day | firebrand
description: firebrand \fi(-)r\-brand\ noun

title: Brooklyn Man Is Charged in Murder of Roommate
description: A Brooklyn man has been charged with murder after his roommate was found dismembered inside their apartment on Tuesday, the authorities said.

title: Maids Cries Cast Light on Child Labor in India
description: The girls screams were brittle and desperate.

title: U.S. Marine Deployment Wont Put China At Ease
description: HONG KONG  The new deployment of U.S. marines to Australia is part of the much-discussed pivot by the United States toward the Asia-Pacific region, a series of muscular military and diplomatic initiatives intended to balance the rise of China.

title: Indias Leaders Dispute Report of Rift With Military
description: Indias top leaders on Wednesday denied a rift between the countrys civilian government and its military brass after an article in a leading national newspaper described a tense episode in January, in which civilian leaders became deeply unnerved when two army units advanced on the capital in an unannounced nighttime drill, Jim Yardley and Hari Kumar write in The New York Times.

title: News Quiz | April 5, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays front page. Good luck!

title: New Clashes Fuel U.N. Skepticism of Promises by Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Spasms of fighting convulsed parts of Syria on Thursday, with clashes reported only miles from the capital. The leader of the United Nations said the conflict was getting worse  contradicting the Syrian governments assurances to a special envoy that it was complying with his cease-fire plan.

title: Keralas Cochini Jews Meld Into Israel
description: On Moshav Nevatim, a dust-blown, palm-tree studded community on the northern edge of Israels Negev desert stands a humble little synagogue with an enormous past. The Kerala Synagogue, as it is called, was built in the style of the synagogues of Indias Cochini Jews, a hardy handful of whom settled Nevatim in the 1950s after emigrating from the Indian state of Kerala.

title: April 5, 1951 | Judge Sentences Julius and Ethel Rosenberg to Death for Espionage
description: On April 5, 1951, Julius and Ethel Rosenberg were sentenced to death for conspiring to commit espionage for the Soviet Union. They were executed by electric chair in 1953, becoming the only two American civilians to be executed for cold war espionage.

title: Test Yourself | English, April 5, 2012
description: This question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article Coronation for Kentucky, and for Its Coach.

title: 97% of Investors Agree to Greek Debt Swap
description: Greek government officials said on Thursday that 97 percent of the investors holding its private sector bonds had agreed to the terms of a debt swap in which they would take a 75 percent loss in return for a new package of debt securities.

title: Preparing for Passover
description: Note: The questions below are based on three articles; you can find the answer to each in the article that is linked from that question.

title: Chiles Youth in Revolt
description: Camila Vallejo leads Chile back into the streets.

title: Camila Vallejo, the Worlds Most Glamorous Revolutionary
description: The hotel had a musty, Pinochet-era atmosphere  dark bar, heavy furniture, bartenders in white shirts and black ties  and drew mostly businessmen. But when the bartenders found out that my friends and I were going to the student march, they cut lemons for us and put them into plastic bags with salt. In case of tear gas, you were supposed to bite into the lemons to lessen the effect. With guarded smiles, they let us know they supported the Chilean student movement and especially its most prominent leader, Camila Vallejo. A bartender said, La Camila es valiente; he laughed and added, Est bien buena la mina  Shes hot.

title: Standing Between the Police and Protesters
description: As the full extent of Greeces financial crisis has unfolded over the last three years, the Greek government has been forced to impose one austerity measure after another: salaries and pensions have been cut. Taxes raised.

title: Is There a Fiscal Crisis in the United States?
description: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Do You Spend Too Much Time on Smartphones Playing Stupid Games?
description: Angry Birds, Fruit Ninja, Draw Something, Words With Friends: All these games are available right at your fingertips, wherever a smart phone, tablet or similar device is available. Are you addicted? When are you most likely to play games like this? Do you think theyre a waste of time  or do you see some value in them?

title: Rocket From Sinai Lands in Israel
description: JERUSALEM  At least one rocket fired from the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt struck the southern Israeli resort city of Eilat overnight, causing alarm but no injuries, police officials said on Thursday.

title: In the End, My Gut Decided Which College to Choose
description: I confirmed my admission to the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities for the fall of 2012 while watching Iowa State lose to Kentucky in a basketball game. As I sat with my family in my living room, my gut twisting with nerves, I knew I was ready to make my decision final.

title: Scouting the Draft: Oklahoma States Markelle Martin
description: Jonathan Bales is the founder ofTheDCTimes.comand will help analyze draft prospects for The Fifth Down in his Scouting the Draft preview series.

title: Fantasy Focus: Four Ways to Make a Profit
description: In order to win your fantasy league, you need the players you acquire to out-earn their draft slots or auction prices; in other words, you must make a sizable collective net profit on your roster. Assuming youre not playing with absolute novices, there are four ways to do this:

title: The Taxi of Tomorrow
description: James Barron and John McDonagh, a New York City taxi driver, step into Nissans new taxi cab, which is expected to appear on the streets at the end of next year.

title: Rothschilds to Combine French and British Assets
description: LONDON  One of Europes oldest banking dynasties is changing to maintain its grip on an institution dating back to the 18th century.

title: Pope Rebukes Priests Who Advocate Ordaining Women and Ending Celibacy
description: ROME  Striking the tone that once earned him the nickname Gods Rottweiler, Pope Benedict XVI in a stern Holy Thursday homily denounced disobedience in the Roman Catholic Church, chastising priests who sought the ordination of women and the abolition of priestly celibacy.

title: Indexes Up as China Acts to Lure Foreign Investors
description: HONG KONG  Stocks in China rallied on Thursday, helped by the countrys newly announced decision to open its markets to more foreign investment and expectations that Beijing might soon take additional steps to bolster flagging economic growth.

title: Spinach Is a Dish Best Served Cooked
description: If spinach has the reputation of being the homework of vegetables, it was not helped by its 70s revival in the form of raw spinach salads. Spinach has many charms  truly singular flavor, the ability to be transformed by cooking in myriad ways, its famous health benefits  but salad is probably the least convincing.

title: Jack Outside the Box
description: In an industrial section of south-central Nashville, stuck between a homeless shelter and some railroad tracks, sits a little primary-colored Lego-block of a building with a Tesla tower on top. The inside holds all manner of curiosities and wonders  secret passageways, trompe loeil floors, the mounted heads of various exotic ungulates (a bison, a giraffe, a Himalayan tahr) as well as a sign on the wall that says photography is prohibited. This is the home of Third Man Records: the headquarters of Jack Whites various musical enterprises, and the center of his carefully curated world.

title: The Verdict on Business Huddles
description: Several weeks ago, during a meeting of our business group, Susan Parker raved about huddles  short, daily meetings that help keep employees moving toward a common goal (heres a guide to holding productive huddles). She and her sister, who own Bari Jay, started huddling at the suggestion of their business coach. Ms. Parker said the practice kept the entire team clearer about what needed to be done and helped the two owners focus on big-picture goals.

title: Doubts Surround Syrian Cease-Fire Plan
description: LONDON  If all goes according to plan  a big if  up to 250 United Nations military observers could soon be sent to Syria to monitor a proposed cease-fire between the forces of President Bashar al-Assad and those trying to overthrow him.

title: A Small Pill, With Positive Side Effects
description: On a cool February morning in north Delhi, 35 third graders sat at small desks in a spartan but tidy classroom,Amy Yee writes in The New York Times. They wore blue school uniforms and listened as their teacher asked in Hindi if they had had intestinal worms.

title: British Central Bank Keeps Rate Steady
description: LONDON  The Bank of England kept its main interest rate at a record low on Thursday because of concerns about higher energy prices and the continuing economic crisis in Europe.

title: Daily Report: Old Money, New Tech
description: Fresh from college and graduate schools, the children of some prominent dynasties are taking a different career path, spurning their legacies in retailing, real estate and finance for a future in technology, Evelyn M. Rusli reports in Thursdays New York Times.

title: Opinion Report: Government Passivity
description: From the editorial page

title: On Our Radar: Missteps in Colorado Fire
description: Forest Service records show that a crew carrying out a controlled burn last month in the forested foothills southwest of Denver failed to ask for a spot forecast of weather conditions. That would have predicted the swirling winds that led to a six-square-mile blaze. [Associated Press]

title: Violet, Lily and Other Flowers of Youth
description: Most of the characters in Whit Stillmans Damsels in Distress the principal damsels, for sure, and also some of the lads identified in the opening titles as their distress  speak in complete sentences and express complex, sometimes startlingly original ideas. This, friends, is news: a movie populated by young people who do not mumble, swear, punctuate their utterances with like or think that an incredulous really? represents the apogee of wit. Even if it did not have other charms, this peculiar, uneven campus comedy would be worth seeing for the delightful felicity of its dialogue.

title: N.F.C. East Team Needs
description: We round out our N.F.C. pre-draft hidden needs series with a look at the television companies favorite division.

title: Delhi Doctor Couple Denies Charges of Maid Abuse
description: The Vermas, the doctor couple who allegedly left their under-age maid locked in their Delhi home while vacationing in Thailand are innocent, their lawyer, Shailendra Bhardwaj, said on Thursday.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: Wall Street Examines Fine Print in a Bill for Start-Ups | Wall Street is examining whether it will benefit from a little-known section of a broad new law that President Obama is expected to sign on Thursday.

title: After Stenson Capsizes, Westwood Grabs Lead
description: The first round of the Masters started uneventfully enough, with pleasant weather and a seemingly attackable course softened by the weeks rain. By late afternoon, it had taken a turn for the weird.

title: France Rules Out Sending Troops to Mali as Rebels Proclaim Ceasefire
description: West Africas regional trade bloc began drawing up plans for military action to tackle the twin crises of a coup and a rebellion in Mali, as Tuareg rebels who have seized control over much of the north of the country declared a cease-fire in their drive to create an independent homeland.

title: The Early Word: Definition
description: In Todays Times:Whether Representative Paul Ryan of Wisconsin, the architect of the Republican spending plan, is an ally or an enemy depends on who is defining him. Mark Landler writes that while Mitt Romney embraces Mr. Ryan and his budget on the campaign trail, President Obama is trying to portray the alliance between the two Republicans as adangerous partnership that would deepen Americas fiscal woes.

title: For $279,000, Terrafugia Transition Puts the Wind Beneath Your Wings
description: Introduced on Thursday, April 5: Terrafugia Transition.

title: Why Is It Ethical to Eat Meat? Ethicist Contest Closes April 8
description: Two weeks ago, The Ethicist asked readers to send in 600-word essays on a divisive topic: Why is it ethical to eat meat? Vegetarians and vegans have long discussed why being an omnivore is unethical. Now omnivores (or carnivores) have a chance to respond.

title: Vain Glorious | A New Day (Spa) in Myanmar
description: Who: Inya Day Spa, Yangon (Rangoon), Myanmar.

title: Yellow and Green Nail Shades for Spring
description: Wild manicures are all the rage for spring, and in todays Thursday Styles, Ruth La Ferla covers the booming business of sparkle, neon and zebra stripes. Meanwhile, I wrote about the cult of yellow and green polish a trend thats only growing hotter despite alienating many a man and manicurist.

title: No More Mr. Nice Guy
description: ISTANBUL  For much of the Cold War, Turkey was NATOs lonely sentinel, patrolling Europes southern flank. Its not surprising that the thawing of that conflict left Turkey feeling somewhat abandoned. Its principal function  a strategic importance to its Western allies  had been devalued by the removal of the Soviet threat.

title: Mixing Religion and Baseball on a Day of Renewal for All
description: This is the season of renewal and redemption, embodied for many New Yorkers by three events that symbolize those concepts and happen to converge this weekend: Easter, Passover and, yes, the start of the baseball season. All three embody an optimism that is the essence of spring, and rings true for nearly everyone but the most dispirited in our midst, sometimes known as Mets fans.

title: Voters Anger May Hinder, Not Help, Republicans This Year
description: MADISON, Va.  Would you tolerate the U.N. and their mandates?

title: Thursday Reading: Gene Mutations Linked to Autism Risk
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and on our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Markets Mixed on Fears About Europe
description: Stocks were mostly lower on Thursday, sending the Standard & Poors 500-stock index to its biggest weekly loss of the year as renewed concern about Europes debt crisis overshadowed a decline in jobless claims to a four-year low.

title: From a Green Corner of the Auto Show, SRT Viper Earns an Unlikely Fan
description: The fire-breathing Dodge Viper, theoretically good for a combined 16 miles per gallon in its 2009 incarnation, was never going to be a Greenpeace poster car. And thats why it was somewhat astonishing to see Jim Kliesch, the research director for the clean vehicles program at the Union of Concerned Scientists, standing front and center when the 2013 SRT Viper was unveiled here Wednesday.

title: Champions League: And Then There Were Four
description: It says something about the Champions League semifinals that Chelsea, a billion-dollar club with a roster stocked full of internationals, is the weak link. But after the Blues slipped past Benfica on Wednesday, theres no denying it.

title: Morning Buzz, April 5: A Soccer Field on the Pier
description: Good morning. It will remain sunny throughout the day, with temperatures rising to the high 50s.

title: What Were Reading
description: Bloomberg Businessweek: The aftermath of the Euro crisis: the long spud lines in Greece. In a nation with no economy, no jobs and fading hopes, young couples, families and pensioners queue for the basic food group: red-mesh 20-kilo sacks of potatoes. A new potato movement is linking farmers to consumers in the interest of mutual survival.  Glenn Collins

title: Ferris Buellers Nights Onstage
description: MATTHEW BRODERICK spent the evening of his 50th birthday late last month at the Imperial Theater, where he will open on April 24 in the new musical Nice Work if You Can Get It. After some cake and a brief celebration he returned to his chores, which seemed like an illustration of the shows title. He was required over and over again to dance with a bevy of beautiful chorus girls who hoisted him off the floor and carried him across the stage before starting to undress him. Not just nice work, it seemed, but hardly work at all.

title: A Poem for the Political Park Slope Food Co-op
description: Dear Diary:

title: (Vegan) Brunch Options Abound in East Berlin
description: Germanys traditional gastronomic portfolio is as meat-centric as they come, but Berlins contemporary food-culture has started shrugging off its carnivorous past in favor of, well, plants. An enduring bohemian spirit and newfound cosmopolitanism have cultivated fertile culinary ground for the citys emergence as the continents vegetarian capital. Here, cruelty-free cuisine holds special sway for weekend brunchgoers  in Berlin, where you dine for Sunday morning das Frhstuck carries as much social import as where you partied on Saturday night. Three East Berlin establishments offering vegan brunch options rise to the occasion.

title: Spring, in the Air and on the Racks, Helps Retailers
description: Retailers sales continued to hum in March, particularly in the trendy apparel sector, suggesting that shoppers are snapping up spring fashions.

title: Poetry Pairing | Easter Wings
description: This weeks Poetry Pairing matches George Herberts Easter Wings with a recent Lives column from the Sunday Magazine, Easter Among Strangers.

title: Morgan Stanley Chief Collected $10.5 Million for 2011
description: James P. Gorman, Morgan Stanleys chief executive, took home a $10.5 million pay package in 2011, a year in which his firms stock price dropped about 44 percent.

title: Finding Her Own Path Back to Broadway
description: LINDA LAVIN surprised the New York theater world last summer when she passed up roles in not one but two hotly anticipated Broadway shows in favor of an Off Broadway play called The Lyons. It was hard to see what was so special about the project: Ms. Lavins character was the matriarch of yet another dysfunctional family; the plays author, Nicky Silver, had an uneven track record; and the production was at a 125-seat theater downtown.

title: Romney Has 2-to-1 Lead Among Republican Voters in New York
description: With three weeks to go before New Yorks presidential primary, Mitt Romney holds a more than two-to-one lead among likely Republican voters, according to a new poll released on Thursday.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Betting On Deadmau5 and Arianna Takes More Control
description: After a decade, money is circling around the concert business again, but this time the interest isnt in Madonna or The Eagles, writes Ben Sisario. Electronic dance music has moved from dance clubs and semi-legal warehouse parties into concert halls and stadiums and private equity is showing interest. If youre 15 to 25 years old now, this is your rock n roll, said Michael Rapino, the chief executive of Live Nation Entertainment, the worlds largest concert promoter. The problem for investors? The business is run by independent investors who have credibility with customers and a roster of star D.J.s but little else.

title: Built to Last
description: If theres anything perennial in fashion, its a pair of black boots, and Robert Clergeries are as enduring as any out there. Roland Mouret, the French-born, London-based designer known for his sculptural clothes, is now the creative director of the comfort-meetsbourgeois- chic brand. In addition to statuesque heels and brogues, hes done several variations on the boot theme: Parisian motorcyclists, sinuous thigh-highs, sturdy jodhpurs (above; $795 at Robert Clergeries New York and Los Angeles stores, and at barneys.com). Women like Catherine Deneuve knew how to wear a really sexy yet practical shoe, Mouret says. And I think todays women are ready for that again.

title: Theater Talkback: Second Helpings
description: Often, it really is better the second time around. Occasionally, the thrill is gone. And then there are those instances  and they are the rarest  when it all seems exactly the same.

title: Ai Weiwei Says He Pulled the Plug on Webcams, on Police Orders
description: Ai Weiwei, the Chinese artist and outspoken government critic, said Thursday that he and his colleagues had disconnected a live Web camera operation from a Japanese server the previous day. Mr. Ai said in a brief text message that he took the action after having been told by police to shut down. Mr. Ai was unable to be reached by telephone late Wednesday, when word of the shutdown of his new webcam operation began spreading, and he sent the text message on Thursday in response to a text message question left by this reporter.

title: The Big Three Tee Off
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  At 7:40 a.m. Thursday, golfs Big Three  Jack Nicklaus, Arnold Palmer and Gary Player  teed off together for the first time as honorary starters at the Masters. All three of their drives found the center of the fairway, although they had to take everyone elses word for it.

title: Refunds for Wedding Gifts After the Couple Splits Up
description: Admit it. Youve sometimes grumbled after buying a nice wedding gift, only to see the couple split up a year or two later.

title: Jack Whites Blue Period
description: For this weeks magazine, Josh Eells has written the definitive profile of Jack White, the former White Stripes frontman who is releasing his first solo record, Blunderbuss, this month. Eells spent close to 14 months on the story, traveling back and forth to Nashville, and it turned out to be a pretty eventful period: White Stripes break up; White and Karen Elson announce their divorce; White quickly bangs out a solo record. And crucially, Eells discovered, the color scheme has shifted. Whites rose period (the inviolable red and white of the White Stripes) is gone. Jacks in a blue period now.

title: Pros Perspective: Before Playing, Workouts and Waffle Houses
description: Mark Calcavecchia won 13 PGA Tour titles, including the 1989 British Open. He almost won the 1988 Masters, but settled for a runner-up finish when Sandy Lyle birdied the 18th hole from a fairway bunker. Calcavecchia, in his third season on the Champions Tour, will provide a daily Masters blog, as well as in-round analysis, for The New York Times:

title: Business Day Live | April 5, 2012
description: Why markets reacted negatively to comments by the Federal Reserve; Kevin Roose lives like a billionaire for a day; and heirs to old money are plunging into technology.

title: Business Day Live: Old Money in New Tech
description: Why markets reacted negatively to comments by the Federal Reserve; Kevin Roose lives like a billionaire for a day; and heirs to old money are plunging into technology.

title: TimesCast | Deadly Blast in Mogadishu
description: April 4, 2012  A deadly bombing at a the national theater in Mogadishu kills the heads of Somalias soccer federation and its Olympic committee.

title: Looking For Victory In Pennsylvania
description: Pennsylvania remains the key to Rick Santorum's survival as a contender for the Republican nomination.

title: A Weekend in Mendoza, Argentina
description: Discover vineyards, mountains and a sandwich called the lomo in this northern region of the country.

title: Three-Alarm Party for Alber
description: There are risks to having a work party in your own home, as the Barneys New York chief executive Mark Lee discovered on Wednesday night when he invited a small crowd of editors to toast Alber Elbaz, once again, on the occasion of his 10th anniversary at Lanvin.

title: 36 Hours in Mendoza, Argentina
description: ARGENTINAS financial crash in 2002 was actually a boon for the local wine industry. The devaluation of the peso meant that winemakers in this northern region of the country could deliver high-quality vintages to the export market at very low prices, even while the cost of making wine was dropping. Real estate prices also fell, and investors rushed in to snap up prime wine acreage at a fraction of the cost in other regions. Ten years later the result is a vibrant wine scene with a great array of bottles for different budgets and palates, cutting-edge eco-sustainable cantinas and a new generation of innovative winemakers. The city of Mendoza itself makes a good base for a visit, with new hotels, restaurants and bars in the historic center, and a mix of architecture that showcases Art Deco alongside 60s modern (the vintage pickup trucks are also a throwback to another era). Just a short drive away are vineyards, adventure sports and resorts under the shadow of the Andes with wine lists that feature the best of the region.

title: Catholic Fund Cuts Off Aid Over Groups Affiliations
description: DENVER  For three years now, Compaeros, a small nonprofit organization in rural southwestern Colorado, has received thousands of dollars from the Roman Catholic Church to help poor Hispanic immigrants with basic needs including access to health care and guidance on local laws.

title: We Need to Talk About Guns
description: How many students have to be shot to death in their schools before this country has a serious discussion about guns? Are the 10 who have been gunned down just since Feb. 27 enough?

title: Walcott: In Sync With City Hall
Excerpt: 'NYC-22'
description: The new police drama, beginning on CBS on April 15, follows a group of rookie officers.

The Righteous Mind
description: To the Editor:

description: 12:59 a.m. | Updated The full version of this post is available here.

title: Chancellor Asks California Community College to Hold Off on 2-Tier Tuition Plan
description: LOS ANGELES  The chancellor of the California community college system has requested that Santa Monica College hold off on its plan to begin offering popular courses for a higher price this summer, saying that the legality of the program is still in question.

title: Life, Interrupted: A Video Diary
description: On April 2nd, Suleika Jaouad, a young adult diagnosed with leukemia, entered the hospital to start her bone marrow transplant process.

title: Warren Street and Broadway, 9:30 A.M.
HSBCs Chairman for Europe to Retire
description: LONDON  HSBC said on Thursday that its chairman for Europe, Alexander Andrew Flockhart, who is known as Sandy, has decided to retire after 37 years at the bank.

title: Life, Interrupted: Countdown to Day Zero
description: Cancer goes hand in hand with waiting  waiting for doctors, test results, appointments, and most importantly, waiting for better days.

title: Former Gingrich Consultancy Files for Bankruptcy
description: Newt Gingrichs former health care consultancy, the Center for Health Transformations, has filed for bankruptcy, according to The Atlanta Business Chronicle.

title: Why Wont They Get Hearing Aids?
description: While visiting my parents recently, I overheard a conversation between them that went something like this.

title: At the Entrance to Augusta, a Familiar Face With a Religious Message
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  As clusters of fans waited to cross Berckmans Road on their way to the main entrance at August National Thursday morning, they could not avoid hearing the booming shouts of Larry Craft, a middle-aged man wearing a bright orange shirt with bubbles on it that proclaimed things like You need Jesus and Trust Jesus.

title: Crime and Punishers on Streets of Harlem
description: IN Harlem sometimes a cane is more than just a cane.

title: Spider-Man Stuntman, Citing Injuries, Starts Legal Action
description: Dj vu, anyone?

description: 2:47 p.m. | Updated

title: A Fashion Low in High Finance
description: The problem with using staples instead of cuff links to fasten French cuffs is not so much that it doesnt work  it doesnt  but that people tend to associate the look with an unattractive mental instability.

title: Video-Game Companies Agree to Close Sex Offenders Online Accounts
description: In an effort to cut off another avenue used by online predators, several video-game companies have agreed to close the accounts of more than 3,500 registered sex offenders in New York State following an agreement with the attorney generals office.

title: Airline Introduces Option For Short-Hauls
description: Travelers who want to shave time off a four-hour car drive dont have many options. Amtraks Acela Express has just a single route. And given airport procedures, flying isnt such a shortcut. Surf Air, an airline starting this summer, has designs on that short-haul sweet spot.

title: Face Time | Mena Suvari
description: I chatted with Mena Suvari in New York, before she had to jet off for her press tour for her new movie, American Pie: Reunion, opening tomorrow. I dont want to miss out on the special brand of humor this movie holds. And I didnt want to miss out on what beauty brands Mena will be taking with her on the road.

title: Happy Opening Day! (Take 3)
description: DETROIT  Happy opening day, Bobby Valentine says, and then he pauses to reconsider. Third opening day. Yesterday, Japan and today. Happy third opening day.

title: An Oakland Neighborhood Branches Out
description: Once known for paint and stamps, the Temescal District is now studded with hip shops.

title: In Minnesota-Boston College, Spotlight Is on the Goaltenders
description: Slap Shot will feature reports from the campuses of colleges and universities playing in the N.C.A.A. Frozen Four tournament this week.

title: Face to Face With the Rebels
description: Gen. George B. McClellan, the former commander of the entire Union force, now commander of the Army of the Potomac alone, started the Peninsula campaign on April 4, 1862, the first step toward fulfilling the promise made to him by Secretary of War Edwin Stanton the previous November: Now we two will save the country. Having landed tens of thousands of soldiers near the tip of the Virginia Peninsula in the preceding weeks, his plan was to push inexorably northwest toward the Confederate capital at Richmond  and victory in the Civil War.

title: 2013 Subaru XV Crosstrek
description: 2013 Subaru XV Crosstrek slide show

title: Sexual Misconduct Complaints Are Up, Investigator Says
Lauren Oliver to Write First Adult Book
description: Lauren Oliver, the 29-year-old author of best-selling teenage novels, will write her first novel for an adult audience, her publisher said on Thursday. Ecco, part of HarperCollins, has acquired Rooms, which will be released in fall 2014. Lee Boudreaux, who will edit the book, said it was as instantly gripping as it was elegantly written, filled with characters and predicaments I still cant get out of my head a week later.

title: Funny or Die Expands Into Commercial Production
description: A company that specializes in nontraditional advertising is expanding into the traditional kind.

title: Cheryl Strayed Talks About Wild, a Memoir of Hiking and Grief
description: In her memoir Wild, Cheryl Strayed recounts her solo trip hiking the Pacific Crest Trail in 1995, when she was 26 years old and in a state of crisis, separated from her husband and grieving for her mother, who had recently died of cancer at 45. Reviewing Wild, Dwight Garner wrote: This book is as loose and sexy and dark as an early Lucinda Williams song. Its got a punk spirit and makes an earthy and American sound. I recently spoke with Ms. Strayed about the book via e-mail. Below are excerpts of the conversation.

title: Romney Says Santorum Should Win His Home State
description: HARRISBURG, Pa.  Greeting voters on a rooftop here, Mitt Romney handicapped his Pennsylvania prospects, which sound a lot like those of Barack Obama four years ago: losing the primary, but winning the general election.

title: J.C. Penney Cuts 14% of Headquarters Staff
description: J. C. Penney laid off 600 employees from its corporate headquarters on Thursday, about 14 percent of the staff there, and said it would close one of its three call centers later this year, eliminating another 300 jobs.

title: Tax Haven Crackdown Creates Opportunities for Bankers
description: LONDON  The worlds tax havens are being forced to clean up their acts.

title: Watch the Mayors Late Night Appearance
description: Its the best job in the world, chimed Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg during his appearance on Late Night With Jimmy Fallon on Wednesday, his first in about three years. He boasted about kissing Lady Gaga, but remained pretty quiet as a photo of him posing with Snooki and The Situation of Jersey Shore was displayed.

title: British Broadcaster With Murdoch Link Admits to Hacking
description: LONDON  Sky News, a British satellite news broadcaster whose parent company is part-owned by Rupert Murdochs News Corporation, admitted Thursday that one of its reporters had hacked into e-mails on two occasions while pursuing news stories, the first time that Britains hacking scandal has spilled into television news.

title: Smaller Navy Ship Has a Rocky Past and Key Support
description: MOBILE, Ala.  The Navys newest ship is designed to battle Iranian attack boats, clear mines from the Strait of Hormuz, chase down Somali pirates and keep watch on Chinas warships. The ones built here even look menacing, like Darth Vader on the sea.

title: 2013 Toyota Avalon
description: Toyota Avalon slide show

title: Death Penalty Death Watch: Abolition in Connecticut
description: It looks like Connecticut is about to join modern civilization: On Thursday morning, state senators voted 20-16 in favor of repealing the death penalty. The abolition bill now goes to the state House, where its likely to pass, and then to Democratic Governor Dannel P. Malloy, who said hell sign it.

title: Letters to the Travel Editor
description: To the Editor: Regarding India: One, Two, Three (March 25), I truly think that the author misses the point of visiting India by recommending overpriced, fancy hotels and driving everywhere by car. This guarantees that one remains in a bubble and contributes to traffic gridlock and pollution.

title: Monaco Adds Art to Its Seaside Allure
description: ACROSS from the grand entrance at Monacos Oceanographic Museum is a monumental cabinet of curiosities. Filled with items ranging from marine specimens to a polar bear to a replica of the worlds first diving suit, the 33-by-60-foot wood, glass and steel structure seems at home in this stunning building that houses an aquarium once overseen by Jacques Cousteau. The cabinet, though, is not part of the museums scientific exhibitions. It is a permanent installation by the American artist Mark Dion.

title: Hotel Review: Nun Assisi Relais in Assisi, Italy
description: THE UPSHOT

title: A Taos Field Evokes the Extraordinary
description: MY favorite place is a field  an ordinary farmers field on the edge of Taos. Its easy enough to find, but equally easy to miss. If youre driving north through town on the Paseo del Pueblo, youll see it on the right, not far after Cids Food Market, a four- or five-acre field edged with cottonwoods on one side, a dirt track along another, and a row of unassuming houses that separate it from the Taos Pueblos land beyond. In the background looms Taos Mountain.

title: At Citi Field, a Campaign for New Owners
description: Hope springs eternal on opening day, they say, unless youre a Mets fan disgruntled with the teams owners, Fred Wilpon and Saul Katz.

title: High in Lombardy, Italy, a Less Crowded Pilgrimage
description: THE spring presents Italy at its best. The lively and colorful celebrations of saints, ancient folkloric customs and traditional feasts build to a peak as the weather warms after Palm Sunday. But the inevitable corollary is that the season can also show the peninsula at its worst: thousands of tourists flock to the classic Venice-Florence-Rome triangle, Italians on vacation flood beaches and mountains, pilgrims swarm to Vatican City for papal Masses in St. Peters Square.

title: Deborah Dickson-Smiths Tips for Family Travel
description: AS an editor and travel writer for LittleNomads.com, a Web site about traveling with children, and a contributor to publications like Holidays With Kids, Deborah Dickson-Smith has traversed the world researching family vacations. But her real education began when she and her partner, Simon Mallender, combined their families and began traveling with five of the most severe critics: their children.

title: Graphic: The Billionaires Club
description: Regardless of who wins the 2012 presidential election, billionaires will come out on top.

title: Restaurant Review: Sotto in Los Angeles
description: On the western side of Los Angeles, where Pico Boulevard transects Beverly Hills to the north and Cheviot Hills to the south, is a kind of no mans land. There is a palpable sense of stasis there, accentuated by the areas most striking landmark, a carpet showroom with an immaculate 1950s facade. But since opening last year, a southern Italian restaurant has been transforming this lonely stretch into a site of culinary pilgrimage.

title: Tunisia After the Revolution
description: BELOW the watchtower of the ancient fortress known as the Ribat, a panoramic view of the Tunisian city of Sousse unfolds. To the east lies the Mediterranean coast, where the Carthaginians moored their navy during epic battles with the Roman Empire. To the south and west, the labyrinthine passageways of the medina, the citys old walled quarter, extend to the vanishing point amid a sea of tightly packed houses and minarets.

title: Profit and Proliferation: A Special Report on Belgian Arms in the Arab Uprising, Part I
description: The uprisings in Libya and Syria have cast the Belgian small arms industry as a case study of the difficult balances within a Western arms-manufacturing community that seeks exports to preserve revenue and local jobs, but risks compromising European policies and human rights values.

title: In AMGs Go-Fast Machines, Start-Stop Gains Ground
description: Mercedes-Benz is bullish on relatively low-cost stop-start systems, which deactivate the engine at idle to save fuel, but the German brands partiality is manifesting itself in an unlikely place.

title: Germans and Swiss Reach Stricter Deal on Tax Cheats
description: PARIS  Switzerland agreed Thursday to a revised tax deal with Germany under which it would pay billions of dollars on funds hidden in its banks by German tax dodgers, the latest step in an international charm offensive that is meant to salvage at least some of the countrys famous banking secrecy.

title: Haunted by Life, Haunted by Wife
description: In the course of her long career, Anne Tyler has done more with a limited number of premises and story lines than perhaps any other novelist working today. Not only do most of her novels take place in the by now recognizable environs of a pleasant, middle-class Baltimore, but they also tend to work inventive variations on a slender handful of themes and character types.

title: Does Your Pet Watch the Hawk Cam?
description: Updated, April 9Last year, we learned that cats couldnt turn away from the Hawk Cam. Readers from all over the country submitted photos of their cats focused on the screen.

title: Lundqvist Says His Forearm Is O.K.
description: PITTSBURGH  Goaltender Henrik Lundqvist said his injured forearm is O.K. after the Rangers morning skate Thursday and that he could play Thursday night against the Penguins if needed.

title: TimesCast | April 5, 2012
description: SkyNews admits to e-mail hacking | President Obama signs the JOBS Act | The Mets begin their 51st season. Correction: This is the Mets 51st season  not their 50th, as an earlier version said.

title: Eurofile | Paris Bed Check
description: Proof that the French are great hotel connoisseurs is a term they coined to describe a certain category of them  htel de charme, connoting a one-of-a-kind place with a big but casually chic personality. Until recently, cabbage-rose wallpaper and shrewd flea-market finds have tended to define the quirky look at this Parisian species, but a fresh crop of properties is adding a major dose of design and creature comforts.

title: Obama and Romney Enter Debate Over Augustas All-Male Policy
description: 3:56 p.m. | Updated  With the Masters getting under way on Thursday, President Obama and Mitt Romney added their voices to the chorus of people calling on the Augusta National Golf Club to admit women.

title: Facebook Is Said to Pick Nasdaq for I.P.O.
description: Facebook, which is preparing for its highly anticipated initial public offering, has picked a home.

description: Introduced on Thursday, April 5: 2012 Shelby American 1000.

title: At Large and Small Companies, Internal Controls Matter
description: The JOBS Act passed by Congress last week and being signed by the president on Thursday helps smaller public companies avoid for a few years the internal controls reporting and audit requirements put in place in 2002 in the wake of prominent accounting scandals.

title: Free Help for People Filing Their Income Taxes
description: This deadline for filing federal taxes this year is Tuesday, April 17. The deadline was extended because April 15, the traditional filing date, falls on a Sunday, and Monday, April 16, is a holiday in Washington.

title: $10 Million Gift Leads to Irene Diamond Stage at Signature Center
description: The biggest theater in the new Pershing Square Signature Center has a name: It will be called the Irene Diamond Stage, thanks to a $10 million donation from a fund created by Mrs. Diamond, a philanthropist who died in 2003.

title: A Public Park to Rival the Yankees Playground
description: When the new Yankee Stadium opened in 2009, not even the loudest of Yankee fanatics could drown out the outraged howls over its costly tickets, its tax-exempt financing and, of course, its construction atop two city parks.

title: Magic Coach Says Howard Wants Him Fired
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  A well-placed Orlando Magic source claims that center Dwight Howard has asked the team to fire Coach Stan Van Gundy. The well-placed source? Stan Van Gundy.

title: 2013 Honda Crosstour Concept
description: 2013 Honda Crosstour Concept slide show

title: Union Ad Stresses the Stress Officers Deal With
description: In a scathing critique of Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly and his administration, the powerful head of the Patrolmens Benevolent Association has rolled out a radio advertisement calling it easier for New York City police officers to deal with criminals than with police hierarchy.

title: 2013 Ram 1500
description: 2013 Ram 1500 slide show

title: Sothebys Goes to Court to Try to Block Seizure of Cambodian Statue
description: Sothebys asked a federal judge in Manhattan on Thursday to bar the government from seizing a 1,000-year-old Cambodian statue that Sotheby`s sought to auction last year for as much as $3 million.

title: Sarkozy and His Rivals Trade Attacks as Vote Nears
description: PARIS  The French presidential election finally began to heat up on Thursday, less than three weeks before the first round of voting, with President Nicolas Sarkozy accusing his Socialist rival, Franois Hollande, of promising a festival of new spending that no one knows how to pay for and risking turning France into Greece or Spain.

title: Twitter and Me
description: I have succumbed. You can follow me at DouthatNYT, for what I hope will mostly be a mix of links to my own pieces, occasional links to other items of interest, and (for the next month or so) near-constant book promotion. But yes, it will probably devolve into a mix of self-congratulatory snark, celebrity retweets, and 140-character demagoguery soon enough.

title: Russian Church Admits Photo Was Altered to Hide Patriarchs Watch
description: Updated | 5:22 p.m. MOSCOW  The Russian Orthodox Church admitted on Thursday to altering an image on its Web site to remove a watch worn by its leader. The alteration was discovered this week by Russian bloggers who suggested that the deleted watch was an expensive timepiece Patriarch Kirill has admitted he owns but claims to never wear.

title: Appeals Court Revives Viacom Suit Against YouTube
description: A federal appeals court on Thursday reversed a lower courts decision to throw out a $1 billion lawsuit filed against YouTube by Viacom and other media companies five years ago.

description: Introduced on Thursday, April 5: 2013 Toyota Avalon sedan.

title: A Ratings Victory for Good Morning America
description: The showdown this week between the Today show and Good Morning America tilted in ABCs favor for the first time on Wednesday, when Good Morning America beat its NBC rival in the ratings by 87,000 viewers.

title: Collector Sues William Eggleston Over New Prints of Old Photos
description: A collector of the classic color photographs of William Eggleston has sued the artist, charging that the value of the works is being diluted by Mr. Egglestons recent decision to sell enlarged versions of some of his best-known images, The Wall Street Journal reported.

title: Spec Obsession Disorder: The Incurable Techie Malady
description: In my Times column Thursday, I reviewed the Nokia Lumia 900 phone. Plenty of people (including Nokia) consider it Nokias last best effort to make some headway in the American smartphone market. Microsoft also has a lot riding on this phone, which runs its Windows Phone 7 software. Like Nokia, its currently flopping.

title: New York Public Library to Digitize Washington, Thoreau and Twain
description: Letters written by George Washington, Henry David Thoreaus pencil-drawn map of Walden Pond and Mark Twains manuscript of A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthurs Court are among the items from the New York Public Librarys American collections that will soon be digitized and made available to the public online, the library announced on Thursday.

title: Philosophers Versus Breeders
description: In last weeks New Yorker, Elizabeth Kolbert reviewed two books that examine the moral case for having children  and find it seriously wanting. Heres Kolberts summary of one of the objections to procreation, from the philosopher David Benatar:
